solution_line_template: Eight less than two dozen bandages is {two_dozen}-{less_than}=<<{two_dozen}-{less_than}={initial_bandages}>>{initial_bandages} bandages.

She needed two bandages on her left knee and three bandages on her right knee for a total of {left_knee_bandages}+{right_knee_bandages}=<<{left_knee_bandages}+{right_knee_bandages}={total_used}>>{total_used} bandages.

Therefore, after Peggy finished putting bandages on her knees there were {initial_bandages}-{total_used}=<<{initial_bandages}-{total_used}={bandages_remaining}>>{bandages_remaining} bandages remaining in the box.
